reviews.text: This past weekend we attended a corporate training event at the Radisson, only to find it in need of repairs/remodeling. There were no signs indicating "renovations underway" so we could only assume that this was the best to be expected. The hotel lobby was bare (no decorations/paintings, etc) with only a few chairs and a couple of tables. The walls were in serious need of repainting and the carpeting looked worn and dirty. Even the bar area had A/C vent fans just above head level that were clearly rusted for some period of time. There were wires dangling from the television and a huge cracked mirror on the wall. The cost of a regular cup of coffee was $3.75 and the service was slow. The positive points we found were clean restrooms, free parking and that the front desk personnel were friendly and helpful. Although we were not staying at the hotel, based on the lobby appearance itself, we would have done an about-face if we were considering staying there. I recommend that some signage be placed to ensure travelers that this is not their normal look.
reviews.title: Not ready to impress corporate event attendees.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great way to celebrate Christmas Eve! A beautiful room with fantastic views, very clean. All rooms are oceanfront. We had a delicious breakfast in their restaurant. It was a very good experience and I'll be staying there again soon.
reviews.title: All ocean view suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: nice and quiet beach. Really nice large rooms and service is ok. Great location.
reviews.title: Great hotel on the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I agree with previous contributors on many points.
reviews.title: Great potential

reviews.text: On the down side although the “Sleep by Numbers” bed was comfortable it did not work at all, and the balcony doors didn’t secure well, allowing the wind to whistle in. The breakfast deal is not worth the effort, a $20 voucher (which excludes taxes and service charge) will just buy you coffee, juice and toast for two.
reviews.title: The bed is heavenly, you'll sleep like a baby!

reviews.text: Stayed here on a weekend with my sister and mother for a girl's weekend. Hotel room was very spacious! I liked that there was a little bar area in the living room and a seperate sink outside the bathroom (great when you have 3 girl's getting ready) Beds are sleep number and that was not a big deal for me. I was surprised that they don't have any "true double" beds. All rooms are king and some offer a sleeper sofa. As a mom of small children, I'd much rather have them in the bedroom with me vs. on a sleeper sofa that has access to a balacony. They do offer kid suites, and I did not inquire about them b/c I did not have my children with us. Beach is beautiful! Sunrises are breathtaking!
reviews.title: Spacious Rooms, Clean but a little older

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here mid week for two nights using a Hot Deals voucher purchased on line. The offer stated 2 nights and 2 breakfasts for $159, with a regular price of $320. I had checked their web site and saw that that they had a deal for that price that included a $20 breakfast credit so I assumed that's what we would be getting. I called the hotel the day after purchase to make reservations and was told that they were not accepting the vouchers even though I had paid in full and they were supposed to be valid for 4 months. The clerk said his General Manager had told him not to accept them; he didn't know the reason why and I should contact Hot Deals if I this was a problem....
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Lousy Manager

reviews.text: I talked to the Hot Deals rep.; she was aware of the situation and said she was trying to work with the manager to convince him to honor the deal and she would let me know. I heard back from her the next day; said they worked it out and I could call the hotel and make reservations. That process took 3 phone calls over about an hours time, transferred back and forth between the hotel and reservation dept., put on hold for lengthy periods and disconnected. I felt like they were trying to make this as difficult as they could.....finally got through to someone at the hotel who took the voucher info and booked the room. Upon check in, the clerk slipped a couple breakfast coupons into the key package, I asked if they had any monetary limit and he said no, they're just for two breakfasts, the "All American or whatever breakfasts they have".
reviews.title: EXCELLENT HOTEL & STAFF

reviews.text: Later that night, I noticed the coupons said 'Free Continental Breakfast' ---'add coffee for $2.95', and sure enough when we went to the restaurant the next morning, the waitress informed us that's all they were good for; the standard cold items, pastry, breads, juice, etc. Being on low carb diets, this was worthless to us and of course the clerk who led me to believe we'd be getting something else wasn't there...
reviews.title: Best stay on the east coast Florida

reviews.text: Aside from being screwed out of a real breakfast, the coupon itself was ridiculous; Seriously, what hotel chain gives you a ' Free Continental Breakfast' and then charges you $3 bucks for a cup of coffee? Motel 6 treats it's guests better than that. The whole experience left us feeling like we were being taken advantage of, like the manager was pissed that he had to honor the offer he made and was taking it out on the guests. The bottom line is even without the free breakfasts, we got a good discount on the stay, although nowhere near the 50% advertised. The suite was nice enough although the sleep # bed wasn't that great; either bowed up in the middle or sagged in...and when level just like any other hard mattress. The view of the ocean from the room and balcony is fantastic, and probably the best reason to stay here. All in all we had a nice time despite the managers efforts to spoil it...this guy really needs to go back to hotel school and brush up on customer relations.
reviews.title: If you want oceanfront, this is your place

reviews.text: Went to Melbourne, FL to watch the NJCAA Women's National Championship Games. We stayed at the hotel, because we were staying 4 nights and wanted a little more room than the average hotel. The rooms were very spacious. However, upon arriving in our room, a GIANT roach greeted us at the door. Okay this is Florida and this does happen, but not a great start. Yet, after we hunted the roach down, we looked around the room, and opened the sliding glass doors to a beautiful balcony looking at the atlantic ocean. Yet, the room seem to have been updated recently, with much of the finishing touches yet to be complete. Trim boards still had peeling paint, and holes in the walls, either shoddy workmanship, or incomplete unsure which one. The pool was closed for the winter, and green from not being kept up, kinda a shock since it was 84 degrees our first day. Sleep Number beds...not a big fan. Trying to figure them out was a chore in itself, but no matter what the bed was saggy by morning. I gave this hotel an average rating because the balcony really did even out the negatives of the hotel.
reviews.title: If you love a balcony and saggy bed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect beach hotel experience. Wall of windows in bedroom and living room, with sliding doors, let us lounge around our room feeling like we were partaking of the ocean rhythms -- pounding surf, gorgeous sunrises. Balcony: comfortable chairs (but no table for drink or lounge chair for napping). Microwave, small refrig (no freezer) and bar sink was a minimal but adequate "kitchenette." Desk faced the ocean and there was amazingly good internet connections. The king bed was a "sleep number," though I'm not sure it worked. When we needed housekeeping or maintenance, they were very speedy. We ordered room service pizza from the hotel restaurant and were able to keep the plates, etc to enjoy our leftovers the next day. There was a pool, but we didn't use it. The beach area was nice, well-maintained. We will definitely return.
reviews.title: Perfect Room With A View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I saw a special deal for this hotel and knew that I had looked at going here before. Therefore, I took advantage of the deal. Every room is a suite with great views of the ocean. The view for many would be enough. Nevertheless, our stay according to the deal also included breakfast each morning. Not really true, it included two breakfasts but two single breakfasts when we were staying for two nights. In addition, the breakfast offered for this deal was simply the continental type, which does not serve my needs at all. We never even considered that as a fault of the hotel more a fault of the deal not giving accurate information. However, when we stayed the first night we found that one of the sliding glass doors to the balcony, the one in the bedroom, did not close shut tight. Therefore, we had a constant whistle of the wind blowing into the room all night. Considering the normal price for a night’s stay and this hotel, I would not have thought something like this would not even happen. Overall, the hotel is OK but I have stayed at much better hotels for a lower price in similar locations. I know that my wife and I will not stay at this hotel again even with the deal we had.
reviews.title: Beautiful Views but…

reviews.text: We chose this property for its proximity to a nearby university and its location on the ocean. For its oceanfront view, balconies, size of suites, and decent pool area it gets 4 stars. But....those are things that cannot be controlled - it was built on the ocean, with balconies and the pool area was designed as it is....although it was nice and clean and of course that is controllable. However....
reviews.title: Great location but...

reviews.text: 1. Tired decor. Please do not put fake flower arrangements that don't even match all over the place. So cheesy. All the soft goods were done in lifeless beiges and browns...there was no design statement at all and public spaces were blah. In room, soft goods were slightly better but not great.
reviews.title: Your place for an ocean view

reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel for an offsite I was at with my company. I was there 4 nights. The room is spacious. I was on the 14th floor and had a sitting room with a desk, couch and TV. The bedroom had a king bed (with a sleep number bed), dresser and great closet space. The bathroom was nice, I liked the way the shower curtain was see-through at eye level so you could see the sun. That was neat. But the best part is the balcony overlooking the ocean. What a sight to watch the sunrise, listen to the ocean and relax. I would leave the sliding glass doors open at night when sleeping so I could listen to the ocean.
reviews.title: Great room with balcony on the ocean, but some minor issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool bar was really nice as were the decks around the pool area. I didn’t get time to use the pool or hot tub but they nice and clean.
reviews.title: Renovation incomplete and sloppy...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But I did encounter some minor issues. The sleep number bed didn’t seem to work. I pressed it and nothing came on. I had maintenance come up and he seemed to get it to come on, but I still had some issues. I finally got it to work but didn’t notice much difference in the bed. Oh well. The last morning I was there, I had little to no water pressure. So when I flushed the toilet the tank would not refill. I had to manually refill it with the ice bucket. Then the shower barely had a trickle. Eventually it got better but this really caused chaos in my morning. I called the front desk and they said there were no problems that they were aware of and offered another room to shower. No time to do that.
reviews.title: Lovely Stay Here - Great Location in Melbourne

reviews.text: The other issue was the elevator. I was in a conference room on the 16th floor and had to go down around 11:50 to get my luggage and bring it back up to 16th floor. But for some reason the elevator would not come get me to go up. I heard it going by my floor and it stopped for people going down. I waited 15 minutes and eventually went down and dropped my luggage off at the front desk. Quite annoying.
reviews.title: Great Week-End

reviews.text: All is all a good hotel. Like the location, the balcony, and the spaciousness. Seems some things could be tweaked a bit.
reviews.title: Relax and Enjoy!
